oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from Virginia Cannon to Sallie Gray Brown
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Addressed to "Mother Brown", this letter is from Virginia Cannon, wife of Staff Sgt. Philip Cannon, who likely boarded with Mrs. Brown during the Tennessee Manuevers. Virginia reports that she has recently learned her husband is a prisoner of war of Germany. Virginia gives Mrs. Brown instructions on writing to Philip and notes that she should "NOT speak of war or victory in your letters." Staff Sgt. Cannon was with Company M, 422 Inf. 106th Regiment.
Sallie Gray Brown of Gallatin, Tenn. was active in the U.S.O. and corresopnded with servicemen from the Gallatin area but also with those who had participated in manuevers near Gallatin.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Cannon, Virginia
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: World War, 1939-1945
